meanings.definition: To handle or control poorly or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: The new manager tends to mismanage important tasks.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial not to mismanage the company's finances.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit hilariously portrays how not to mismanage a business.
meanings.sent4: Trying to mismanage a project is like steering a ship without a compass.
meanings.sent5: She always finds a way to mismanage even the simplest of assignments.

meanings.definition: To fail to manage or administer properly.
meanings.sent1: If you mismanage your time, you may miss important deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The team's lack of communication led them to mismanage the project.
meanings.sent3: The movie character's attempts to mismanage his own life provide comic relief.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting to plan is a sure way to mismanage any situation.
meanings.sent5: He managed to mismanage every opportunity that came his way.
